item.title: National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2022

item.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to without objection.
Passed/agreed to in House: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to without objection.
Considered by unanimous consent. (consideration: CR H7836)
Without objection, the Chair laid before the House S. Con. Res. 24.
Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment by Unanimous Consent. (consideration: CR S9309; text: CR S9306)
Passed/agreed to in Senate: Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment by Unanimous Consent.(consideration: CR S9309; text: CR S9306)

summary.text: This concurrent resolution directs the Secretary of the Senate to make corrections in the enrollment of S. 1605 (National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2022) to amend amounts relating to the Eielson Air Force Base and AEGIS Ashore Barracks Planning and Design in Redzikowo, Poland.

This concurrent resolution directs the Secretary of the Senate to make corrections in the enrollment of S. 1605 (National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2022) to amend amounts relating to the Eielson Air Force Base and AEGIS Ashore Barracks Planning and Design in Redzikowo, Poland.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
